title: Auto Makers Agree to Stricter California Tailpipe-Emissions Standards
text:
The White House is pushing back on a new agreement between California and a handful of car companies on fuel-economy standards, potentially deepening a regulatory rift between the Trump administration and the nation’s most populous state.

Ford Motor Co., Honda Motor Co., BMW AG and Volkswagen AG said Thursday they have voluntarily agreed to meet stricter tailpipe-emissions standards than have been proposed by the Trump administration. The companies said the agreement is intended to show support for a single, nationwide vehicle-emissions...
description: Four major auto makers say they have agreed with California to voluntarily meet stricter tailpipe-emissions standards than are being proposed by the Trump administration, a move that could pressure the White House to compromise on easing regulations.
